meanings.sent1: The misanalyses of the data led to incorrect conclusions.
meanings.sent2: Researchers must be careful to avoid misanalyses when interpreting results.
meanings.sent3: The misanalyses in the report made everyone laugh at the meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her misanalyses of the situation painted a completely wrong picture.
meanings.sent5: The misanalyses in the experiment were like following a misleading map.

meanings.definition: misanalyses: third person singular present of misanalyse
meanings.sent1: He misanalyses the situation every time he tries to understand it.
meanings.sent2: She often misanalyses people's intentions, leading to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The robot misanalyses the commands and ends up doing the wrong tasks.
meanings.sent4: His mind misanalyses reality, creating a distorted view of the world.
meanings.sent5: The detective misanalyses the evidence, causing him to suspect the wrong person.
